text:
How can I convert an array of arrays of 3 integers to a dictionary of Cartesian coordinate triplets?

```
Input:[[x, y, z], ...]
Output: Dict(i => CartesianIndex(x, y, z), ...) 
```

elements.text: How can I convert an array of arrays of 3 integers to a dictionary of Cartesian coordinate triplets?

[[x, y, z], ...]
Output: Dict(i => CartesianIndex(x, y, z), ...)

text:
comprehension:
```Dict(i => CartesianIndex(v[i]...) for i in eachindex(v))```

elements.text: Dict(i => CartesianIndex(v[i]...) for i in eachindex(v))

text: Thanks!  Now, how can I write a function to create a view of this dictionary with its keys and values flipped?

elements.text: Thanks!  Now, how can I write a function to create a view of this dictionary with its keys and values flipped?

text: if I understand what you want to do correctly, that's not possible. To flip a dict, you need to create a new one and hash all the now-keys. That can't be done as a view

elements.text: if I understand what you want to do correctly, that's not possible. To flip a dict, you need to create a new one and hash all the now-keys. That can't be done as a view

text: values may be non-unique, so it doesn't work in the general case

elements.text: values may be non-unique, so it doesn't work in the general case
